function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Diminished efficiency of pacs as mechanical ventilation in rooms increases","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate air mixing in rooms with a mixing ventilation system may result in atypical distribution of micro-organisms, increasing infection risk.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited investigation of the effects of hepa filters on ventilation grills and in real-world settings may lead to incomplete understanding of their efficacy in reducing viral transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of virus transmission patterns in various indoor spaces, including restaurants, houses, classrooms, and gyms, may lead to ineffective infection control measures.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Natural ventilation may be compromised in cold weather, leading to reduced outdoor airflow.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mechanically ventilated rooms may have significantly varying ventilation rates depending on their location and layout.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Displacement ventilation promotes vertical stratification and higher ventilation effectiveness but may have mixed cost-effectiveness.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Co2 concentration as a sole indicator for airborne infection risk","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of air flushing in reducing particle concentrations","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in controlling ventilation rate for natural ventilation","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation rates in high-occupancy buildings leading to increased risk of airborne disease transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Adverse outcomes of increasing ventilation rate, including indoor discomfort, higher energy consumption, and increased co2 emissions","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Significant variations in hvac operation requirements, such as ventilation rates, indicate a research gap.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"No rules for periodically monitoring indoor air quality in a facility.","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ventilation alone cannot prevent indoor airborne transmission.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of economic, environmental, and social outcomes of interventions related to indoor air quality iaq control in buildings","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited exploration of social effects of fm strategies and inconsistent findings","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unwarranted assumptions regarding occupant productivity and work schedules","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited focus on community-level infection risk","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Environmental impact of fm interventions not fully considered","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on technical measures for health outcomes evaluation","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Hvac interventions reducing airborne transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incorporation of highly related review papers","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Environmental impact of fm interventions","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of focus on infection control in certain facility types","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited coverage of specific pathogens in fm interventions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of focus on integrated fm interventions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Focus on healthcare facilities and educational buildings increases the risk of virus transmission in these high-traffic areas.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of ventilation rates in facilities","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate environmental cleaning and maintenance","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffective building measures for virus mitigation","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Scarcity of papers studying interventions in fm activities for respiratory infection control","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inclusion of non-journal items like conference papers, government reports, and commercial briefs","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of quantitative outcomes of interventions in background articles","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited scope of research may miss important fm interventions for mitigating indoor respiratory infections","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider all soft service activities as potential sources for respiratory pathogen transmission","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited studies on respiratory infection control through fm activities","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Gaps in fm activities that contribute to infection control","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and indoor air quality control leading to pathogen transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proper environmental cleaning leading to hospital-acquired infections hai","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Occupant behavior impacting pathogen transmission","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of virus from infected individuals to the community due to quarantine facility leakage","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor understanding of sars-cov-2 transmission mechanisms leading to errors in quarantine site selection and controls","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate indoor infection control in constructed environments leading to high transmission rates of respiratory viruses","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global threat from respiratory viruses such as sars, sars-cov-2, influenza, and tuberculosis tb .","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential psychological burdens and societal harms from harsh npis and lockdowns.","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Quarantine failures leading to indoor infection in existing buildings.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective risk communication in outbreak management","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Government not effectively communicating risk","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertain and unexpected outcomes","category":"Unknown","confidence":"High"}]}
